show.subtitle: Specific information about using evidenced based natural health choices, with knowledgeable authors, guests and hosts.
show.title: The Natural Nurse

title: Caryn Hartglass
content:
Host Ellen Kamhi, PhD RN, www.naturalnurse.com, interviews Caryn Hartglass. Caryn was born and raised in New York. She received her Bachelor and Masters of Science degrees in Chemical Engineering from BucknellUniversity and worked in the semiconductor industry for 20 years.
With a passion for helping people understand the affects of food choices on health and environment, she ran the nonprofit EarthSave International as Executive Director for over 8 years.
An ovarian cancer survivor, Caryn combines science with practical knowledge from real life experiences lecturing around the world about the powerful, healing benefits of a plant-based diet, juicing and meditation.
She has appeared on Dr Oz, Geraldo At Large, 20-20 and CNN.
A classically trained singer, she has performed in opera and musicals in the United States and abroad and has won two international competitions (France, South Africa).

Caryn Hartglass is the host of two weekly Internet radio shows, It’s All About Food and Ask A Vegan.
She is the founder of the nonprofit organization Responsible Eating And Living (REAL), http://responsibleeatingandliving.
com/, which delivers easy to use, factual information and services, providing inspiration to take responsibility to nourish, protect and support ourselves, our families and the Earth with whole, plant-based foods and planet-friendly products.
More about Caryn can be found at her website, www.carynhartglass.com or on twitter at @REALWorldwide
